clinical_study.brief_title: Study on Impact of Edoxaban Treatment in Cancer Patients With Venous Thromboembolism During Antineoplastic Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase IV Study on Impact of Edoxaban Treatment in Italian Cancer Patients With Venous Thromboembolism (EDOI Cancer Study) During Antineoplastic Therapy

lead_sponsor.agency: Gruppo Oncologico Italiano di Ricerca Clinica

clinical_study.source: Gruppo Oncologico Italiano di Ricerca Clinica

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicentric, phase IV study. In this study patients that are receiving an antineoplastic treatment and that have been diagnosed with venous thromboembolism will receive edoxaban as per clinical practice. Edoxaban will be administered according to summary of product characteristics. Patients will receive 6 to 12 months of treatment with edoxaban administered orally. The thromboembolic event will be monitored as per local clinical practice. In this study patients will be evaluated at baseline, at the beginning of therapy with edoxaban, after 1 month (+/- 7 days), after 3, 6 and 12 months (+/- 3 weeks). During these visits, patients will be provided of a diary in which they should report drug intake and interruptions and quality of life questionnaires.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the impact of edoxaban related adverse events on antineoplastic therapy
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of antineoplastic therapy delays/interruption due to ADR related to edoxaban (bleeding, hepatobiliary toxicity, renal toxicity, anemia, hypersensitivity reactions).
Quality of life will be evaluated using validate quality of life questionnaires.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the compliance to Edoxaban treatment
secondary_outcome.description: For every patient the number of edoxaban tables used will be assessed and compared with the prescribed dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the safety of edoxaban treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The adverse event severity grading scale for the National Cancer Institute Common Terminology for Adverse Events, Version 4.0 (NCI CTCAE v4.0) will be used for assessing adverse event severity.

intervention.description: Every patient will receive every day edoxaban orally once a day. Edoxaban therapy will start after at least 5 days of lead-in with low-molecular-weight heparin, as per clinical practice. Edoxaban will be administered at dosage of 60 mg/day. In case of patients with body weight â‰¤60kg or with renal failure (creatinine clearance between 15 and 50 ml/min) or that are treated with P-gp inhibitors (cyclosporine, dronedarone, erythomycin, ketoconazole), dosage will be 30 mg/day. Patients will be treated for 6 up to 12 months with edoxaban, as per medical decision.
